newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss stocks end last 1996 session slightly lower.
newsitem.headline: Swiss stocks end last 1996 session slightly lower.

text.p: Swiss shares closed the final session of 1996 with slight losses in listless trading and no clear trend.
Position-squaring or profit taking was the main activity seen today, dealers said.
The Swiss Market Index (SMI) of blue chip shares closed 6.1 points lower at 3,942.2 points, giving a 19.5 percent rise for the full 1996 year.
The Swiss Performance Index (SPI) shed 3.74 points to 2,511.88 points, an rise of 18.3 for 1996.
Lower Roche certificates, which shed 80 francs to 10,415 francs, weighed on the index, traders said. Novartis registered shares rose three francs to 1,533 francs.
Biggest gainer among blue-chips were SMH registereds, which gained 2.75 to 191 on dollar firmness, a dealer said.
Swiss markets are closed on Wednesday and Thursday and reopen on Friday.
